title: Kadium – App for staying ontop of YouTube channels' uploads
Ask HN: Any good adaptive math apps for older kids?
text:
During the pandemic, we tested dozens of math apps for kids.

Our main criteria were they had to be adaptive, secular, accurate, fun and engaging for the kids.

We found some really fantastic ones. And through these, a lot of our kiddos were able to jump through the entire K-8th grade math curricula in a single year.

Some of our favorites: Math Tango (K-3rd) Beast Academy (K-8th) Prodigy Game (K-8th) Great for practice, some errors/bugs Dragon Box Algebra

Unfortunately, now that are kiddos are at the 9th grade level, the options seem sorely limited.

We can't really find any great, adaptive math apps for higher level math , that really encourage critical thinking and problem solving.

I've scoured the secular homeschool groups on FB and reddit, looked through the app store, asked math teachers, but no luck so far.

One of our parents is even thinking of building his own...

Wondering if anyone here has tried anything they liked? Or possibly building something our kids could try?

Thank so much!

Ask HN: Market Dilemma
text:
I've noticed that in the market we are in there is still no clear winner and that competitors, even the big ones, are very easy to steal customers to. Also it's clear to me that most of the big players in the market are running just by VC's money trying to blitzscale or simply bruteforce product market fit, by hiring a huge sales team and spend money in a clear unsustainable growth. Is this a sign that there is still a big space for innovation in the market or that the problem with the current available production costs is not worth solving?

Hopefully I've explained clearly the dilemma I have in my head, pls give feedback.

Adding some context: we've built a gym management system app. We have few clients and a modest MRR which is growing (slowly) overtime.

Ask HN: macOS – is there a multiple “workspace” solution?
text:
Let's say I wear multiple hats in work. In some hours I have to focus on on-call and support; In some I need to develop new features; And in others I need to manage infra.

Each hat contains a separate "workspace" consisting of a set of Chrome tabs _IN TWO SCREENS_ as well as maybe a set of PyCharm/Datagrip projects.

I'd like to be able to switch between each workspace without much delay. For now I group different tabs in Chrome and use different windows but it's already a chore to find the correct window when there are 4~6. The perfect solution looks like this: I press a pre-set key, and suddenly 2 Chrome windows show up, one in left screen and one if right, also the right projects are opened in PyCharm/Datagrip - not only that, but the windows of other "workspaces" immediately hide themselves.

I think the minimum solution is for Chrome to display the name of a group instead of the activated tab when I right click the icon. I can live with opening different PyCharm/Datagrip projects once in a while.

What tools can I achieve this?
